item.title: More furniture outside 14 Firbank Road, 1st July
item.description:
More furniture/rubbish has been left outside 14 Firbank Road. Has been moved around (probably by the person who dumbed it) including on Saskia Mews entrance. Thanks for looking into this.

item.title: Abandoned Car for over 1 month, 1st July
item.description:
I am writing on behalf of residents on Park Gardens regarding a vehicle that appears to have been abandoned. The car has been parked in the same spot for over one month and has not moved during this time. We have spoken with neighbours and the local garage, and all have confirmed that the vehicle does not belong to them. It is currently blocking access to number 19, whose resident is elderly and has ongoing health issues. This is causing distress and inconvenience. Additionally, parking is already limited on Park Gardens, and the vehicle is occupying a space needed by residents. Could this please be investigated as a potentially abandoned vehicle? The details are as follows: Location: Outside number 19 Park Gardens Make and Model: Ford Colour: Blue Registration Number: KG05AWW Thank you for your support in resolving this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Gardens, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping corner Westdale Rd and Eglinton Road, 1st July
item.description:
There is a large amount of fly tipping on the corner of Westdale Road and Eglinton Road. It consists of general rubbish/household waste, garden waste, diy waste and furniture that is being added to weekly. This bout of fly tipping was first reported on 21/05/2025, but for some reason it is not being removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westdale Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 1st July
item.description:
As you are aware (someone from the council knocked on the door to ask if the rubbish was ours !) there have been several items dumped in the alley way and people seem to be adding to it daily. I cannot see how the refuse collectors will access it tomorrow and so the problem will only get worse. Despite telling residents not to put cardboard out (as it will not be collected ) they still do. Please also supply them with recycling bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible doors coming from first floor flat in both buIldings, 1st July
item.description:
You genuinely can't open windows in flat without terrible odors filling the flat from 1st floor flat Continuous smells and cooking isn't an issue but 24/7 foul odors coming from the flat is unacceptable. Housing officers need to check/send warning letter
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tudor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting behaviour from resident, spitting over balcony, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Double Mattress dumped on Westdale Rd's grass bank, 1st July
item.description:
A double mattress has been dumped on the grass bank opposite 1A Westdale Road. It is hidden behind one of the large trees. This was first reported over a fortnight ago (FixMyStreet ref: 7716717). My concern is, when it starts to rot, it will be difficult for it to be completely removed, and it will contaminate the ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westdale Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ben, 1st July
item.description:
Directly behind my driveway and it has been there for over three weeks and it is very difficult to back out of my driveway as sheridan crescent is narrow. It is also parked facing the traffic coming down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheridan Crescent, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Outside 168 haverstock hill , middle of the road, 1st July
item.description:
There is a pothole outside 168 haverstock hill , close to the middle of the road . every time a bus or a lorry passes by , its shaking my house . The same thing happened 10 years ago and it break the main sewage pipe going to my property . Its cost close to Â£50,000 to repair . So please fill the pothole as soon as possible . The issue is there for couple weeks .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 168, Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
